@ks: good thought! and include the fact that ZeroID is an insecure thing and the result it not nice at all! We do need a better way to handle identification!

And by the way, it is possible. Zero users have an id that is used as their folder names. I'm sure it's possible to do for users the same thing wo do for zites! Let new users have an id, and those who want a name - go and make a name in Namecoin! A decentralised solution!
@ks: /me gone to buy more namecoins, since ZN has quite a big impact on it's cost =D
And when it comes to names, I think that NMC is better than NXT. It's not nice when IDs don't expire.

are there any peers beside yourself? You can't publish the thing unless there any peers to receive it. If you can sign the zite, things are fine already.

No peers found. Sorry. Check your ZeroHello. Is your port open? My isn't , so I can't get a file from a closed-port peer.
@Flyman: Binchan is right. Use proxy. And when there are no peers, you don't have to publish. Just sign it. New peers will download fresh version.

The same thing. Could not remember the name. When I've read this post, I've remembered. Don't know why has that happened, but thanks!

It's "The Outforce", in my case =D

damn it. I'm interested. But it's 4:18 here and I have a new job that starts about tomorrow....

---

it's your fault I haven't slept. Thanks. Without you it would have been my fault =)

@Flyman:
> no peers
Closed port. See portforwarding, static IP. You need that.
> publish
That action tells present peers that there is content update. New peers get fresh content anyway.
> Achron
???
@Emeraude: interesting, thanks for the link

So true. I think it's also worth mentioning, why is there "key" in "switch off". First switches that were developed, were actuelly keys that you had to turn It's also why there is "turn on" and "turn off". Russians simply haven't changed the word when the key had changed into a switch.
I thought he would say "I'm a sharpshooter!" Or a sniper or whatever.. I guess I am blood thirsty today.

In most cases they care too much about sync between lips and the translation. Which results in things you describe and also in just making large portions of interesting discussions into "blablabla" and "that's what I think".

about update: Why would you delete old files? It is much better to update existing files, because ZNet can upload updated parts if the file to existing peers. You can make a small change to your site every minute and still there won't be much difference in the traffic (even though you publish stuff to 6 people).

I've opened the link and my ZN died. Deletion of the folder and reboot of the phone helped. Check the site a couple of couple of times. 
The second time, the site opened, but nothing loaded.
